meanings.sent1: Many people have different occupations to earn money.
meanings.sent2: Teachers, doctors, and firefighters are all examples of occupations.
meanings.sent3: The clown's occupation was to make people laugh at the circus.
meanings.sent4: Her occupation as a chef allowed her to create culinary masterpieces.
meanings.sent5: Finding the right occupation can bring fulfillment and happiness.

meanings.definition: The act of occupying or taking possession of something.
meanings.sent1: The occupation of the enemy's territory was a strategic move.
meanings.sent2: The occupation of the park by protesters lasted for days.
meanings.sent3: The squirrel's occupation of the bird feeder caused a commotion.
meanings.sent4: The occupation of the throne symbolized the king's power.
meanings.sent5: The occupation of the top floor provided a stunning view of the city.
